info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 14 at 4:00PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Henderson, Polk, northeastern Greenville and northwestern Spartanburg Counties through 430 PM EDT... At 400 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Columbus, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Columbus, Landrum, Tryon, Campobello, Saluda, Mill Spring, Gowensville, North Saluda Reservoir, Glassy Mountain and Green Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
